comment_body: Overriding coverage, as this PR is a fix for unittests.

Could you please fix title and description? Copy from the original PRs
Coverage bypassed as the PR is only formatting changes
@mint570 , just realized, we need to have a consistent style. Understand that a later PR is converting it back but I think we can consider this in review and close this. What do you say?

@prsunny what do you mean by "consistent style"? SONiC code today follow the Microsoft clang style mostly, but not exactly. We are using Microsoft style for code upstream by running the clang command in the PR description. This will ensure the same style on our PRs. We are doing this for P4Orch codes only. We are not doing this for other SWSS codes.

Or do you mean we can review https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-swss/pull/3066 directly without this PR? The format change in that PR makes it very hard to review the real change. And we don't know the code coverage error in that PR is due to format change or not. If that's what you mean, I will suggest to merge this PR first. I can handle the rebasing on the other PR. Once this PR is merged, our later PRs will be much cleaner.

The only concern for this change is we may have limitation on the number of qualifiers we can programmed in a single ACL table on some platform. But given the L3 table definition used to work in 202012 branch, it should be fine.
hi @neethajohn  could you run test with 202305 image? And we also need to test with Mellanox platform in case this change break theirs.

@dgsudharsan please look into the test failure. Thanks!

The same three test, namely test_mysid, test_mysid_l3adj & test_srv6 have also failed in this run for the first time. This run is for a master PR on Mar 11 FYI.

https://dev.azure.com/mssonic/build/_build/results?buildId=496703&view=ms.vss-test-web.build-test-results-tab

2311 did not have the change specified in the PR used in above link. 

So, i tend to think the root cause of the failure is something else and this test appears to be flaky. Anyway retriggering now to see if this is solved

SRv6 test failed which is not relevant to my change.
```

    
        Args:
            table_name: The name of the table from which to fetch the keys.
            num_keys: The expected number of keys to retrieve from the table.
            polling_config: The parameters to use to poll the db.
            failure_message: The message to print if the call times out. This will only take effect
                if the PollingConfig is set to strict.
    
        Returns:
            The keys stored in the table. If no keys are found, then an empty List is returned.
        """
    
        def access_function():
            keys = self.get_keys(table_name)
            if wait_at_least_n_keys:
                return (len(keys) >= num_keys, keys)
            else:
                return (len(keys) == num_keys, keys)
    
        status, result = wait_for_result(
            access_function, self._disable_strict_polling(polling_config)
        )
    
        if not status:
            message = failure_message or (
                f"Unexpected number of keys: expected={num_keys}, received={len(result)} "
                f'({result}), table="{table_name}"'
            )
>           assert not polling_config.strict, message
E           AssertionError: Unexpected number of keys: expected=2, received=1 (('oid:0x3d000000000619',)), table="ASIC_STATE:SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_SRV6_SIDLIST"

```

> can you explain how this change take care of this also [sonic-net/sonic-buildimage#7434](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/issues/7434) ?

@abdosi, The earlier fix for this problem was also trying to achieve the same.. However, it was doing manipulation on Receiving LC side(to massage the mac address so that it programs with Sender LC's mac address) by assuming that All linecards will have first 5 octets of Macaddress be same and last octet will be based on switch-id..

Snippet from the earlier PR: 
To fix this problem, for VS platforms, if the inband interface is port type, staic neibhbors for voq
neighbors are programmed with mac = neighbors's owner asic's mac. With
this change, since src mac and dst mac are different and since we also
program neighbors for all the remote asics, the packet will be sent out
correctly.

My Current fix generalizes the approach by programming with same Mac address as sent my sender Linecards. Now, we dont have any restrictions of Mac addresses to be used across linecards (just that they need to be unique across linecards/Asic).

@stepanblyschak can you test below sequence?

 
Step1:- Insert a cable that needs custom SI setting on ASIC side on say port A
Step2: Remove the above cable and now insert another cable which does not need any custom SI setting on ASIC side on same port A

Ensure link comes up in both above cases

@stepanblyschak , @prgeor , in general orchagent code should be idempotent. So even if same value is set again, it should pass down the value to SAI implementation. From what I understand, its causing flaps in some cases. PR is good to me, but just want to share the thought.

@prsunny
This PR is very important for TWAMP Light. And PR (https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1306) has been merged.  We expect TWAMP Light to be pushed in the release version of 202405. 
So please help to review this PR or invite others to review it. And If you can merge it, please help to merge.
Thanks very much.

> **What I did** Implemented the TWAMP Light feature according to the SONiC TWAMP Light HLD(#1320).
> 
> **Why I did it** Part of the TWAMP Light feature support.
> 
> **How I verified it** It Implemented VS test.
> 
> **Details if related** sonic-swss-common: [sonic-net/sonic-swss-common#823](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-swss-common/pull/823) sonic-sairedis: [sonic-net/sonic-sairedis#1306](https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-sairedis/pull/1306)
